author: Dan Miranda
text: "Let's cut to the chase
column5: you're gonna love it. This place is very old school Italian
column6: do expect a little bit of that in the heart and soul of this place
column7: from the food to the staff. Our bartender and server Denise was delightful
column8: and made our one year anniversary dinner absolutely delightful

author: Eric P
text: 'Authentic and incredible old school Italian restaurant that stands among the best in the nyc area for classic red sauce spots. The service and people makes it unique to itself. 100% must try. Try the chicken parm (pictured)
column5: artichoke francaise
column6: or the pork chop!'

author: Staci Hilsheimer
text: 'Had been waiting months to have dinner here and was really disappointed. The food was EXCELLENT
column5: but service sub par
column6: the portions for the price?? I would be very upset if I was charged the $5 sharing fee for that amount of calamari.  We had out of town guests and felt rushed to enjoy dinner and conversation.  We also realized that our tip was already included (party of 5) something our waitress ( who btw was very friendly) did not tell us in advance. In Hoboken you can find great food everywhere but atmosphere and service in today’s world is still #1.'

author: Abigail James
text: 'Lovely place for a nice dinner with the family.'

author: Elizabeth D'Amato
text: 'Excellent service
column5: food and atmosphere. All deserve five stars.\n\nHomemade sauce
column6: breaded pork chop was top notch. Also freshly filled cannolis are great.'

author: Melissa Sheehan
text: 'I’ve lived in hoboken for 5yrs - This place survives on its reputation for being exclusive and hard to get into. I had the linguine with clams and found it to be too garlicky and the sauce was broken - we make it better at home. We were sat just after 7 and asked to get up at 8:36
column5: after we had just ordered a bottle of wine with dessert. Around 8:45 we were again asked to get up from our table
column6: despite the fact that we weren’t notified of a table time limit when we were sat and most places offer a 2 hour limit when there is one. During the meal
column7: we were also told to stop chatting so we could select an appetizer.'

author: Oscar Abreu
text: "What can you say about this place other than that everything is amazing from the ambience to the food to the staff to the patrons. This place is awesome! Amazing food
column5: drinks are always topped off and Denise is amazing!!! Will always come back to this place! Order the Chicken Danielle(I think that's how it's spelled )"

author: Karen Parziale
text: 'Bad attitude!!!!! Owners wife is nasty.'

author: Jose “Joe See” Gomez
text: 'Reasons i removed 2 stars\n1 star for being overpriced. Almost 23 dollars for 3 shrimp cooked in brandy and butter. That comes out to 8 dollars a shrimp when accounting tip. This is by far a rip off. Overly priced. Only a 3 star Mich can get away with those types of prices. (The shrimp were okay
column5: nothing memorable about them)\n\n1 other star was knocked out because the food was
column6: well
column7: bland? The veal parm had no seasoning. It was just
column8: fried and breaded. IV had better else where.\n\nThey only accept cash
column9: i wont knock a star off for it.\n\nThey had good service or at least reasonable rotation and water coverages. The bus boy was on point
column10: he was the quarterback. If not for him this place would get 2 stars.\n\nCheers!'

author: Ron Antonelli
text: 'Great Restaurant in Hoboken
column5: NJ.'

author: Joe
text:
"Walked over to check out a new spot.

Upon entry i was asked if I had been there before so they could let me know that it's cash only.

Ran next door then back in less than 5 minutes. Asked for a table outside and the hostess asked the waitress for table of 1 at which she scoffed and shook her head as I was standing there.

It is an hour before they close and pasta/Italian so not sure why that response was warranted.

I immediately said never mind. Instead of talking to the employee to say how inappropriate that was
column5: I was offered a table at the entrance of the restaraunt. You can't even make this up. This must be family owned because no customer should ever be treated that way. I happened to be the only minority inside or outside
column6:
so imagine how I felt experiencing this real-time.

I'm not saying it was a factor but it definitely did not make me feel welcomed at all.

I declined the table and left."

author: David Torres
text: 'One of the best Italian food in Hoboken. The make you feel like eating incredible homemade food.'

author: Rebel Hippy
text: 'Augustinos is the best thing in Hoboken!\nI have eaten almost everything on the menu and theres nothing i dont love
column5:
drinks are also great!
Cute indoor and outdoor dining.
If youre in the city dont let the Hudson get kn the way! I live in nyc and have no issue hopping on the NJT 126 bus for 15 mins to feast here plus you can go for a nice walk along the river to see the city skyline before or after the meal.

Im usually too busy enjoying my time there to take photos but will make the effort to do so during my next visit!'

author: Modern Lunatic
text: 'Two glasses of wine
column5: one order of cheese ravioli and one order of lasagna was $126 and it tasted like Olive Garden leftovers.'

author: Sheila Culhane
text: 'Food and service was awesome!! Will definitely go back again'

author: michael rieger
text: 'Spectacular food'

author: Joan Lazar
text: 'Excellent food. Excellent vibe. We arrived early and they took us. Clean
column5: safe
column6: delicious. Highly recc.'

author: S Ramos
text: 'Perfect! The food is amazing and delicious. Recommend this place highly.'

author: Ryan Duran
text: "It's incredible!"

author: Matt Krekel
text: "Wonderful place!  Atmosphere is great
column5: food is out of this world. I did not get the flagship meal-the pork...  I saw it on another plate.. It's huge. And I wasn't near that hungry.\n\nI don't remember exactly what I had... It was a whole (both lobes) chicken breast stuffed with all sorts of goodness and topped with mushrooms.  I was in heaven. Wife got the clam linguini. Both were amazing dishes. Next time I'm back visiting
column6: I'll be sure to come by.\n\nAs a note
column7: talked to a few patrons while we were eating. All recommend various dishes..  But one had a standing appointment on the 4th Monday of the month who brings a different friend with them each visit so they can enjoy the food as well. If that doesn't explain the quality and the enjoyment of the establishment

author: Ken Boyar
text: 'My last review of this restaurant was 8 years ago. So it\'s time to tell you that Augustinos is still #1 in Hoboken (and possibly anywhere). The food is superb and while some like to refer to the staff as "saucy"
column5: they are genuine and lovely and will make you feel like family. People in this town who are sour on Augustinos probably just can\'t get in !'

author: Eileen McCarren
text: 'Ordered take out tonight to support them. Waited one hour and twenty minutes for the call back I was promised for the woman who took our order. When I called back and asked about our order I was told I never got an order under your name. I said thanks we won’t make this mistake again for take out. So our star review is “0” after my order
column5: name and number was taken. I have to leave a single star to record the review.'

author: Michael Borelli
text: 'Best restaurant in Hoboken'

author: Mary-Ellen Fargnoli
text: 'Was finally able to order take out from Augustino’s  and they did not disappoint! They were written up in the NJ Star Ledger this summer for their especially wonderful pork chops. It’s hard to get reservations because they are that good so I took advantage of take out during this time. I got the breaded pork chops which blew me away. They were actually 2 double pork chops and absolutely delicious. Highly recommend! This will provide me with at least 2 other meals. Compliments to the chef and staff
column5: you deserve recognition.'

author: Deep Vira
text: 'Delicious authentic Italian. They were able to prepare everything according to our dietary restrictions.'

author: Alexandra Mullen
text: 'Absolutely DELICIOUS food and amazing service too! Owner is super friendly and great atmosphere. Thank you for everything we will be back!'

author: Ronald Landau
text: "Expensive. We each had a glass of wine and an entree. No appetizer
column5: coffee or desert and with the tip it was $91. Food was ok
column6: not great.\nThe restaurant was highly recommended especially the pork chop which was $38. I didn't order as I thought it was overpriced .\nWaitresses were delightful which made up for the slow service. It took almost an hour for our entree to be served. We won't be back."

author: Elodie Rached
text: 'Just of the hook delicious say it with me delicious'

author: JAMES MURPHY
text: 'Great home cooking and even better service!'

author: Mohini Sarin
text: 'The food was overpriced for average portions and cold but the staff didn’t seem conscientious and were unfriendly or at best phoney ‘friendly ‘. The other customers who gave low ratings in their comments about ‘cash’ only . A great inconvenience . They do not automatically provide receipts unless you request. The Barman was the rudest . I was not sure how much cash I had given him as I have vision problems due to retinopathy and other impairments and he just slammed down the change . I had already told him to keep  $ 22 plus change for the tips for the staff . When I called back to ask for break down for expenses as I realized he had not provided a proper itemized receipt
column5: he ran through the food items and told his staff ‘ it was That Woman’ ! How disparaging and disrespectful  to his customer . It just shows they only concerned about the ‘cash’ not  courteous customer service . I was very hurt and called back realizing he had not given me the breakdown of the drinks. He seemed annoyed ran through the beverages quickly not even letting me explain there could have been a mistake as we never ordered Chardonnay and he slammed phone down . Spoilt my brothers birthday ambience . Left bad taste in our mouths . Will Never return leave alone recommend . Better Italian restaurants With less arrogant attitudes and far more friendly And humble attitude . Let Augustinos eat humble pie . If they want to refund me I’ll go back'

author: Joseph Mag
text: 'We had a great time especially during the crazy time. The food was delicious and the staff was amazing. It just felt like you were home
column5: they made you feel very comfortable. I had the pork chop is amazing . Cash only'

author: Hector G
text: "You don't know what you're missing.  One of the best meals we've had once again.  This is one of the few pleasures we've had during the pandemic.  It was wonderful as always."

author: William Newman
text: 'The restaurant is welcoming
column5: the staff friendly and helpful and the food is fantastic.'

author: Jeannette Calle
text: "The complimentary bruschetta is very delicious. I'd buy that stuff by the gallon."

author: Martha Wilson
text: 'GREAT PLACE!'

author: Paul Mignone
text: "Ever since I moved to Hoboken
column5: I have wanted to eat at Augustino's.  There is this hype surrounding Augustino's as being sort of the Rao's of Hoboken.  A place that's difficult to get a reservation that serves great food.  Given the current pandemic
column6: my wife and I thought this would be a good chance to finally try Augustino's.  Knowing they are busy (even just doing takeout)
column7: we ordered at 4 pm with the hope to be eating sometime shortly after 5 pm.  I called to place our order and the woman on the phone sounded flustered.  She took my order and was very curt
column9: polite enough.  She said she would call back to let me know when I can pick up the food and that it would be around 5 pm.\n\nWe waited patiently and at 5:40 pm
column10: I called the restaurant to check on the order.  This wouldn't have been the first time a Hoboken restaurant has messed up/or even missed our order.  Again the woman sounded flustered and I told her I was following up and that we've been waiting since 4 pm.  She told me I could come in five minutes.\n\nI walked to the restaurant
column11: go inside and I was asked which order I was there to pick up.  When I told her my name
column12: the woman began berating me for calling to follow up on my order.  I was completely taken aback.  I felt like I was little kid being disciplined by my mom.  Imagine the audacity to follow up on an order after waiting an hour and forty minutes.  I waited a moment and tried to make a joke about it and this just further triggered her.  She went on a mini-rant
column13: saying they're not making McDonald's back there.  She went on to say
column14: she didn't care how long ago we placed our order because all of these other orders (pointing to the bags of food) were waiting just as long  The whole incident was bizarre.  I was getting the sense that in her mind I should be grateful they are allowing me to buy their food.  I starting thinking to myself that I should just leave
column15: I don't need their food.\n\nThe total was $61 and I started sorting through my cash to get the money and I handed her $60 and was looking of a single dollar.  When I handed her the $60
column17: though she could clearly see I was still looking for another dollar.  Her level of impatience was unbelievable.  Who treats their customers like that?!?  I was nothing but polite through this entire situation.\n\nNow to the food.  We ordered calamari with sweet sauce
column18: chicken parm and cheese ravioli.  I would not normally order chicken parm
column20: I read so many rave reviews
column21: I felt compelled to try.\n\nThe calamari was pizzeria quality.  It was not good.  If you want the best calamari in Hoboken (or perhaps the best you've ever had) go to Tutta Pesca.  Also
column22: the owner there is kind and appreciative of his patrons.\n\nThe chicken parm was good
column24: I can get comparable chicken parm from a number of other restaurants in Hoboken without the side order of attitude.\n\nI can't speak for the ravioli
column25: though my wife said it was OK.\n\nI've been to Augustino's two times
column26: first and last.  This is unfortunate
column27: because despite the average food this time
column28: I would like to have tried something else that had rave reviews to see if they are as good as advertised.\n\nOne thing I can say with certainty is don't believe they hype!  There are better alternatives in Hoboken."

author: Leon Sanchez
text: "As soon as I walked in 10 minutes on my reservation
column5: I was approach by a manager in a very racist manner telling me that because I was late I have to eat quick or to go and eat at the bar
column6: it was my girlfriend birthday and I felted so uncomfortable that I told my girlfriend
column7: l don't like this treatment let's get out of here but insisted on staying
column8: we had to order the food in5 minutes and eat it in 30"

author: Robert Williams
text: 'At the moment  you come to that place  they give you an agreeable feeling. Very courteous team
column5: it is a kind place to hang out with friends or with your date. tasty  meals
column6: talented  chief cook and stuff
column7: comfortable  pay and professional  service. Highly recommended.'

author: Chris Smith
text: "Seriously you can't go wrong here!!!  The food is spectacular!  The staff is beyond friendly and helpful!!  If you are reading this review you need to book a table now!!"

author: Adam Broitman
text: 'My favorite place in Hoboken
column5: bar none!'

author: Morris Goldberg
text: 'Great Italian Food. Some of the staff is fantastic and some are horrible ....'

author: Michael Young
text: "SIMPLY AMAZING!!!  Best Italian I've had in the Northeast!  Well done Augustino's!!!"

author: Anna Clement
text: 'This place has gone down the drain in food and service quality. I was excited to take my friend from Florence to dine here and he ordered the clam linguini that was basically noodles in an oily soup. The worst part was after the dinner was over the waitress proceeded to tell us she had someone waiting to sit down and shooed us out! I was mortified! You pay good money (cash only which is already inconvenient) for sub par food and horrible service. I will not be back!'

author: D Please
text: 'I grew up on homemade ravioli and theirs are the closest you can get from a restaurant.  Shrimp scampi and fish oreganta dishes are all great. Scoff up the meatballs when they have them. Sauteed spinach and vegetable sides all great. Fun time. Will have to fight through the shtick to get a reservation here but authentic people with authentic food. Best in area so it deserves to have an edge.'

author: Juan Jose San Segundo
text: 'The worst restaurant of Hoboken\nTerrible service and food'

author: Ashley Lanza
text: 'It pains me to write this
column5: as I always looked forward to an upcoming Augustino’s reservation. After this last visit
column6: though
column7: I will absolutely not be returning. Our group of five made a reservation three months in advance for 9:30pm. I’m a former Hoboken resident and was traveling from out of state for a super short trip
column8: and booked this reservation as one of the only things I’d get to do with my family. The day before the reservation
column9: they asked if we could make it 9 instead
column10: only to call us an hour before our time and move it back to the 9:30 time. Sure
column11: no problem. We show up for our 9:30 reservation
column14: and assuming it will only be a few minutes
column16: as the restaurant is quite small. Mind you
column17: it’s freezing out. After about twenty minutes
column18: we head in and stand against the wall waiting to be seated. Around 10:00
column20: I tried to order two drinks at the bar. The woman who always mans the phone area says she’ll bring me the drinks because I can’t stand in her area. Another twenty minutes go by
column21: still no drinks. At this point I accept that we’re not getting our drinks
column22: but I see them wiping down a table which I assume is ours. Wrong! Another group walks in around 10:15 and is immediately seated. Now irritated
column23: I walk up to the woman near the phones and tell her we’ve been here for well over a half hour. She says the people that just sat had a 9pm reservation
column25: so they get seated first. Mind you - they weren’t even physically here waiting! If they called them and told them their table was ready
column26: why couldn’t they do the same for us? They saw us waiting there for about 45 minutes and never even had the courtesy to tell us to wait inside when we were standing out front. At this point
column27: we are all exceptionally irritated. This woman was beyond rude
column29: and condescending. She said ‘there’s nothing I can do. Everyone was late tonight.’ Why wasn’t I told that when she called me an hour before my reservation time instead of wasting our entire night? She acted as if it was our fault. I can’t imagine speaking to people like this in general
column30: let alone at the business you run. It was a horribly irritating and exceptionally embarrassing experience. I recently moved out of Hoboken and hyped this place up to my family big time
column31: only for them to have this experience as first-timers. You can find delicious food on every single block in this city. Without good service
column33: you don’t deserve any of the CASH people pay to be there. They’ll read this review and they won’t even care
column34: because all they care about is just that: the cash. Looking back it’s now easy to see their entire schtick is all so fake and unauthentic.'

author: john cunning
text: 'Still the best Italian in town'

author: meredith braunstein
text: 'My husband took me here for my birthday! Wow!! I can’t wait to come back. Food
column5: ambiance
column6: and I love the staff. Definitely coming back soon.'

author: Richard Elman
text: 'I can’t believe that I lived in Hoboken for 10+ years without ever going here.  It’s fantastic.  The second I walked though the door
column5: I knew by the aromas in the dining room
column6: I was in for a night of good food.  We (thankfully) got to taste everyone’s dishes and everything was exceptional.   Veal picatta
column8: lamb chops and GIANT veal chops were all so flavorful and well prepared.  We also had the juiciest meatballs and the calamari (and its tomato sauce) was the best I’ve ever had.  Great servers with sass! Make a rez and go.'

author: Jason Labes
text: 'Traditional food
column5: service
column6: style. Very good experience.'

author: Jo Hayes
text: 'Always delicious'

author: William Saunders
text: 'CASH ONLY!! Wish I had known that going in - other than that it was delicious. Small and cosy and intimate. The ladies that work there are like your friends pushy mom from high school who wanted to be the cool mom so they let you drink beer at their house but really they just wanted to make sure their son never went anywhere. Make sure you also have enough cash to tip them or they will stare at you with cold judgement.'

author: Olivier Lachaud
text: 'Excellent food with an authentic feel. The ambiance was homey and casual'

author: Avinash Sunny M
text: 'Great food and ambience... Time space and waiters are bit rushed all the time. Portions are over sized.. be prepared pack some. Desserts a pass.. so 4.5'

author: Howard Mittleman
text: 'Great food. Only 8 tables. Wonderful wait staff.'

author: Karen B
text: 'Came for the food
column5: left feeling like family. Absolutely lovely people who run this restaurant of 22 years. A true New York experience. Amazing.'

author: James Foley
text: 'The best Italian food in the tristate'

author: madeline schettina
text: 'Extremely noisy
column5: very close quarters
column6: food is mediocre. Overrated!'

author: george ziccardi
text: 'Bread'

author: SLDM & Associates LLC
text: 'The best!'

author: Scott Sanowitz
text: 'Amazing italian'

author: MARIA AMICO
text: "Augustino's
column5:
what a fun place to go.
Owner is very pleasant  and full of fun.
Makes the experience  worth the wait.
No last minute reservations  here.
If you want  to go
column6: plan months in advance.\nVery small restaurant BUT exception food.\nYou never want to leave. You just want to eat
column8: and laugh...wish I lived closer.\nAmazing..artichokes  to die for...\nCan't  say enough

author: Dan Begallie
text: 'Had a friend with a reservation and got us in.  Great meatballs and amazing wait staff.  The pork chop (breaded) was also outstanding...'

author: Simon Morris
text: 'Perfect comfort food'

author: Warren Lively
text: 'Lovely restaurant. Cozy and have delicious food'

author: Seth A Levin
column5: 'Simply the best!'

author: Harshada Prabhune
text: "Everything was delicious. They were very flexible about converting their pasta to vegetarian. And it was very good!! It's a cash only place."

author: Christian Torres
text: "Amazing place. The food was amazing and the service is one of the best I've experienced."

author: John Burke
text: 'Nasty people'

author: Ann Pirrello
text: 'Great food'

author: Mario Catanio
text: 'Stood place for lunch.'

author: Vincent Bellucci
text: 'Great Italian restaurant.   Sharron is an awesome owner/waitress
column5: makes you feel right at home.  Food is some of the best Italian food. Chicken parmigiana and breaded pork chops are a must.  And make sure it is someone’s birthday.'

author: Dave Masters
text: 'Fantastic italian restaurant with a lively staff that makes you feel at home. Couldnt rate highly enough.'

author: Matthew Lucciola
text: "Authentic Italian American restaurant with amazing food and people. Cannot say enough good things about this place
column5: make reservations way in advance or try to get lucky at the bar. The owner is a sweetheart and really is so warm and inviting
column6: some people just don't understand how we show it
column7: could transplant her into my family and noone would know. Will be going here for years to come."

author: Orlando camacho
text: "(Translated by Google) The best pizza I've ever had
column5:
spectacular.

(Original)
La mejor pizza que he probado
column6: espectacular."

author: GoRow Studios Hoboken
column5: 'Rocks! Entertainment at its finest'

author: Pilar Morales
text: 'I give this review not because of the food
column5: it is delicious.  But the service and the attitude is awful.  They are rude and presumptious and think that the customer owes them vs they owe the customer a nice experience.  They are so obnoxious that the owners sister has the gall to sit at the bar instead of allowing a standing customer.  Places like these are obsolete and Augustinos in the long run will not be relevant.  In the end there are a million Italian restaurants'

author: Amanda Vittitoe
text: 'Food is good and atmosphere is cozy.'
